notes: Miller (2017) 'The Persistent Effect of Temporary Affirmative Action'. Event study of federal contractor status on black employment share using EEO-1 establishment-level panel. Main results in Tables 2-3, Figures 3-4. Regulation and deregulation event studies. Data is confidential EEO-1 microdata, not included in the package -- only do-files are provided.

design_audit.notes: Regulation event study. Lead/lag dummies F6-F2, L0-L6 around first federal contractor year. F1 (t=-1) omitted as reference. Absorbs unit and division-by-year FE.

claim_object.estimand_concept: Dynamic ATT of regulation on black employment share, event-study coefficients
claim_object.target_population: EEO-1 reporting establishments that become federal contractors (excluding those entering as contractors)

constraints.notes: Paper uses only ln_est_size and ln_est_size_sq as time-varying controls throughout all specifications. No variation in control sets across main specs. Constraint is effectively fixed.

canonical.notes: Clustered at firm level as in all paper specifications.

budgets.notes: Control set is fixed (only 2 size controls). Budget driven by design variants (FE alternatives, sample restrictions) and focal parameter choices.

sampling.notes: Full enumeration. No control-set combinatorics needed.

diagnostics_plan.notes: Joint F-test of pre-treatment leads being zero.
Visual inspection of pre-treatment coefficient path.
